metadata.name: 9.4.b Density of expressways and motorways per 1000 km²
metadata.definition: Percentage of persons in households living below relative poverty threshold which is determined at 50% of the mean expenditure at the level of all households.
metadata.methodology: The basis for calculating the indicator is the total length of express-ways and motorways as of 31 December. In accordance with the provisions of the Act of 21 March 1985 on public roads (uniform text, Journal of Laws 2015 item 460): a) an expressway is a road specially designed for motor vehicle traffic and which: – is provided with one or two carriageways, – has multi-level crossings with any road, railway or tramway track, footpath or waterway, with rare exceptions when one-level intersections with public roads are allowed, – is equipped with devices intended for serving the travelers, vehicles and packages, and reserved only for motorway users. b) a motorway is a road specially designed for motor vehicle traffic and which: – is provided with at least two permanently separated from each other carriageways for the opposite directions of traffic, – has multi-level crossings with any road, railway or tramway track, footpath or waterway, – is equipped with devices intended for serving the travelers, vehicles and packages, and reserved only for motorway users.
